column4: i did gksu "update-manager -c"  and it downloads the upgrade tool but nothing happens... how do i upgrade?
it should than after checking for updates show a button on top that says there is a distro upgrade
make sure you are up to date first sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade  than try the tool again
what version are you on now?
asks to check for updates manually
ok you may have to do it manully than. i have to ask mvo about that
hes not online atm i will get in touch with him and find out why server kernels are doing that. its been on my agenda for weeks and havent gotten to it
you need it to do the upgrade properly (it may fial if not installed)
than do it without it but its a good chance it will fail and leave you unstable system
with the set up you have you might be safer installing from cd
than dapper is the safest bet
